biblStruct.note: Ephraem de Nisibis, a Syriac writer in the middle of the 4th century, employs a rich angelology throughout his hymns. In his collection of “Hymns on the Faith”, he attacks the rationalist posture of Arian theology by relying on scriptural examples and the referring to the model of the silent and reverent angels. They therefore appear as models of the apophatic theology that he promotes. They are also actors in a celestial liturgy of which earth is a reflection, according to the concept widely shared by the Syro-Antiochian liturgical tradition.
